responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty chatty when it comes down to it, especially if there's a good laugh or a bit of mischief to share. But sometimes, I'm just as happy listening to Hermione go on and on about something important or playing a round of chess with Harry. I mean, who needs to be the one always talking when you've got mates like us? We've got each other's backs no matter what, so being able to talk or stay quiet is all part of keeping things together, right?

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon everyone's got their quirks, and sometimes those quirks can get on my nerves. But honestly, I try not to dwell too much on faults—I mean, we've all got enough trouble without looking for more, right? And hey, when it comes to my mates, I’m always gonna have their backs, even if they mess up every now and then. That's what true friendship is about, isn’t it? Standing together through thick and thin, not just pointing out the bad stuff.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do a right good job when it counts. Like when those Dementors were threatening Hogwarts, I didn't let up, did I? And yeah, sometimes my plans might be a bit bonkers, like the time I helped turn the family ghoul into a sick doppelgänger to fool Mum, but hey, I always keep an eye out for my mates and the right thing to do. Even if things get a bit hairy, like being an Auror after the war, I've always given it my all. So, yeah, I think I give it a proper go, especially when there's something important on the line.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Well, I reckon it's been a rough road, hasn't it? There've been times when I felt like the world was closing in around me, especially with losing Fred and seeing what happened with Buckbeak and Sirius. Those losses hit pretty hard, and there've been moments when I've felt right blue. But hey, I've got Harry and Hermione by my side, and that's what keeps me going. They remind me that even when things look their darkest, there's still a bit of light left if we stick together. And let's not forget, there's always a bit of humor to be found, even in the worst times, right? That's how I try to keep myself from getting too down.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do come up with new ideas every now and then. Take the ghostly platter George and I cooked up – it was a bit bonkers, but we thought it might make a difference in how the living and the dead interact. And during the Calamity, I remember sharing some tips on dodging curses with the Aurors. It's not like I'm always planning stuff out; it just sort of happens when I'm thinking on my feet, you know? Mostly, I'm all about keeping the gang together and coming up with ways to cheer everyone up, even if things look pretty grim. Like when I helped grab sweets for Harry on Halloween – that always makes everything a bit better.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Reserved? Me? Nah, I'm more of the type who lets his thoughts fly out before he can catch them sometimes. Especially when it comes to talking about food or my love for chess, I'm all over the place. But when it comes to standing up for what's right or my friends, I might surprise you with how determined I can be. Even though I can get jealous or feel overlooked at times, I'll always step up when the stakes are high.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I try to be, you know? Like when I sacrificed myself in that chess game to get Harry and Hermione past that board. Or defending Fleur against Mum and Dad when Bill started dating her. Sure, I can be a bit of a prat sometimes and not see things clearly, but when it comes down to it, I’m always ready to do what needs to be done for my friends. And now, even with my lot of kids running around, I still think about helping out, whether it’s giving advice on how to avoid getting hit or just cheering someone up with a bit of humor. So yeah, I guess you could say I'm pretty helpful and unselfish when it counts.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Yeah, I can be pretty careless sometimes, especially when I'm under stress or just don't think things through. Like that time I tried to summon my father's flying car to rescue Harry and me from the Dursleys—it worked, but it was also a bit nuts and got us into trouble. And then there was the incident with the ghoul, pretending to be sick to skip school and go on a mission with Harry and Hermione. Those were definitely moments where I let my impulsive side take over. But at the end of the day, it’s usually all about protecting my friends and doing what’s right, even if it means bending the rules a little.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I'm more the type who gets a bit twitchy when things get stressful. But when it comes down to it, and the pressure's really on, my friends always help me find the courage to carry on. Whether we're saving a hippogriff or facing down dark wizards, knowing Harry and Hermione have got my back makes all the difference. So, yeah, maybe I don't handle stress with the coolness of a Malfoy, but I've got my own brand of bravery that kicks in when I need it most—thanks to a bit of luck and a whole lot of mates.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Well, I've always been one to dive right into the weird and wonderful stuff, haven't I? Like that time me and George tried making a platter for ghosts—thought it was pretty brilliant even if it did look a bit spooky! And there's nothing like seeing a Canary Cream work its magic to get me all excited about what else we could come up with for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. Sure, sometimes I feel a bit out of my depth, but when you're with friends who believe in you, it's easier to keep curious and hopeful, even when things get dark.

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon I am pretty full of energy, especially when it comes to facing challenges or just having a bit of fun. Like, who doesn't get a kick out of turning into canaries with a Canary Cream or cheering on Krum at a Quidditch match? And let's not forget those times when I had to be brave, like helping Harry distract Umbridge or drinking Felix Felicis before a battle. It's all about keeping that hope alive and being ready for anything, you know? That's what keeps me going.

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Well, I don't go looking for fights, but sometimes my temper gets the best of me, especially if someone's messing with my family or friends. I've had my fair share of arguments, sure, like when Ginny was kissing Dean and I went off the handle—I mean, it's just that I care a lot, and sometimes I feel like I need to prove myself too. But at the end of the day, it's all about standing up for what's right and who you love, isn't it?

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I’m as reliable as a Chocolate Frog card is likely to show up in a pack. I mean, I’ve been there through thick and thin with Harry and Hermione, haven’t I? From dodging curses in the Department of Mysteries to planning wild schemes to get Slughorn talking, you can count on me to step up when it matters most. Sure, I’ve got my moments where I’m a bit flighty—I did run off back to the Burrow when things got tough once—but in the end, I always come back, ready to help out. Whether it’s defending Fleur when no one else would or showing Aurors how to keep their heads in a duel, I’ve learned to rely on the people around me and they can rely on me to do what needs doing, even if it means taking a few risks along the way.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Yeah, I can get pretty tense, especially when Harry or Hermione are in danger. There’ve been times when I’ve felt like my nerves were going to snap, what with all the battles and stuff we’ve been through. But you know, no matter how scared I am, there’s this part of me that just knows I’ve gotta hold it together and stand up for what’s right. It’s not always easy, but being tense just means I’m ready to act when I need to.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm exactly known for being a deep thinker or ingenious, more like... well, let's just say I've got my moments. Sometimes, it's those quick side-steps in a duel or coming up with a cheeky plan to catch a memory from old Slughorn that get people talking. And honestly, when you're surrounded by friends like Harry and Hermione, it helps to have a bit of both bravery and brains. But really, it's the magic and the thrill of the unknown that keep me going and make my mind whirl with ideas, even if they don't always work out the way I think they should.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do get pretty enthusiastic, especially when it comes to Quidditch or facing down some Dark wizard nonsense. There's nothing like the roar of the crowd or the thrill of an adventure to get my heart racing and my spirits up. Sometimes, though, it's all a bit overwhelming, and I find myself wishing I could just shine without all the pressure. But hey, it's part of what keeps life interesting, right? And when things get tough, knowing I've got mates like Harry and Hermione by my side? That's the best kind of enthusiasm booster there is.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do have a forgiving nature, but it's not always easy. Like when Lavender and I split up, there was a bit of a mess, but I guess I learned to forgive her for getting on my nerves a bit too much. And with Fleur, my family had their doubts, but I stood by her because I knew Bill cared for her, and that's all that really matters. When it comes to mates like Harry and Hagrid, though, forgiving is a given. They've been through so much with me, I can't let some slip-ups get in the way of our bond. It's all about sticking together, especially when things get tough.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be a bit all over the place sometimes, mate. My room back at the Burrow was always a mess, and I’ve lost more homework than I care to count under the couch cushions. But when it comes down to the real stuff—saving my friends, standing up for what’s right—that’s where I find my footing. The rest of the time, I’m just trying to keep up with everyone else, really. And hey, I reckon there’s nothing wrong with a bit of chaos if it means having fun and making some great memories along the way, right?

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Yeah, I do worry a lot, especially when it comes to my mates and what dangers they might face. It's hard not to when we're dealing with dark wizards, Dementors, and all sorts of other nasties out there. But somehow, even when things get really scary, I find the strength to stand up and fight alongside Harry and Hermione. I reckon that's what true friendship is all about – sharing the worries and facing them head-on together.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got a bit of an active imagination, especially when it comes to dreaming up new tricks and pranks. Remember that time me and George tried to make a platter that looked like a ghost but actually tasted like fresh bread? It was a right laugh trying to figure out how to do that! But yeah, sometimes my imagination just runs away with me, especially when I'm trying to cheer everyone up or solve a tricky problem. And honestly, without a bit of imagination, how would I have survived all those adventures with Harry and Hermione? We needed all sorts of crazy ideas to outsmart You-Know-Who and his gang. So, I'd say it's pretty useful, even if it does get me into trouble now and then.

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Nah, I'm not usually the quiet type. I mean, I've got my moments when I need to think things through or when there's something heavy on my mind, like after the battle when it felt like everyone was counting on us. But most of the time, I reckon I’m pretty vocal, especially when it comes to standing up for what’s right, like when we promised to save Buckbeak. And let’s not forget, I can get a bit carried away talking about stuff, like those ghosts at the party or my weird platter that turned out okay. I just want people to know that I’m here, ready to help and protect, not just be a bystander.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be trusting, especially when it comes to my mates. There's nothing like having someone's back and knowing they've got yours. Like with Harry and Hermione, I've always trusted them to do what's right, even when things get hairy. But there's a line, you know? Sometimes, you gotta be careful who you trust, because not everyone's got your best interests at heart. Still, I reckon it's better to have hope and be ready to lend a hand when it really counts.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Well, I reckon everyone has their lazy days, but when it comes down to it, there’s not much time for that when you’re fighting Dark wizards and all sorts. I might not always get things right on the first try, especially when it comes to Quidditch, but I do my best to stick around and see things through, no matter how tough they get. And when you’ve got friends like Harry and Hermione, well, you can’t really afford to slack off, can you? They always have my back, so I figure it’s only fair I do the same for them.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Well, I guess it depends on what you mean by "emotionally stable." I've had my moments, like when I was jealous of Harry or got upset during the Triwizard Tournament, but when it comes to fighting for my friends and what's right, I've always managed to keep my head straight, even if my heart was pounding like mad. I'm not one to back down easily, especially when it matters. So yeah, maybe I'm not the calmest bloke around, but I reckon I can handle myself when things get tough.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I'm more of a practical sort than inventive, but I've come up with some pretty nifty ideas under pressure. Like that time I used a family ghoul to pull off a disappearing act at Hogwarts or when me and George whipped up a banquet platter that was supposed to look all spooky for the ghosts. It wasn't exactly inventing a new spell, but it did take a bit of creativity. And during the Calamity, I taught Aurors a thing or two about dodging spells and staying alive—that might count as being inventive too, right? In the end, it's all about using what you've got to help your mates and keep things going, even if you don’t think you’re the cleverest bloke around.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty assertive when it comes to standing up for what I believe in, especially when my mates are involved. There's nothing that gets me going like defending Harry or Hermione, or anyone we care about. But sometimes, it feels like I'm always playing catch-up to their brilliance, and that can make it hard to speak up. I guess you could say I've got moments where I really shine, but other times, I just need to find my courage again. In the end, though, I do what I gotta do, even if it means taking a few risks along the way.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Cold and aloof? Me? Nah, that's not really my style. I mean, sure, there might've been times when I felt down, like when I got separated from Harry and Hermione, but even then, I couldn't just shut people out. My mates mean everything to me, and I reckon if there's a way to cheer someone up or stand up for what's right, I'll jump right in, even if I do muck things up sometimes. So no, being all icy towards folks isn't something I'm good at. More my thing is trying to keep the mood light, even when stuff gets pretty serious, like during our adventures. And hey, if you ever need a laugh or someone to have your back, I'm your guy.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Well, I'd say I do me best to stick it out, especially when it comes to standing up for what's right. Sometimes, I might feel a bit daunted, but with the right mates by my side—like Harry and Hermione—I find that inner spark of hope that keeps me going. Whether it's dodging curses or trying to uncover some secret memory, I reckon it's all about keeping your head clear and relying on the ones you trust. And yeah, maybe a bit of luck potion doesn't hurt either, but mostly it's just about not giving up, even if things get a bit chaotic.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely be moody at times. Just ask Hermione or Harry—they've seen me go from super excited to totally down in the dumps faster than you can say "Accio broomstick." But you know, it’s all part of being human, isn’t it? One minute I’m all about cheering everyone up with a bit of humor, and the next I’m feeling a bit left out or jealous. It’s like that time at the Christmas party, where I was all hopeful and then suddenly hit with a wave of disappointment when things didn’t go exactly how I wanted them to. But no matter what, when it comes to standing up for what’s right or for my friends, I’m always there with a clear head and ready to take on whatever comes our way.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do appreciate a good show or a bit of magic now and then, like seeing the sky light up at a Quidditch match or watching the wedding guests dance under the stars at Bill and Fleur’s wedding. But let's be honest, I'm more of a bloke who likes action and adventure. Artistic stuff can be nice, but it's the thrill of the game or the magic of being with my mates that really gets me going. And hey, if you ask me, the best kind of art is creating something useful, like what Fred and George did with Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. That's got flair and brains behind it!

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Well, I reckon there've been times when I've felt real shy and worried, especially when Mum tried to hold me back at The Burrow or when those Dementors were hanging around Hogwarts. But you know, when it comes down to it, my friends always pull me through. And when things get really tough, like trying to save Sirius or facing off against the Death Eaters, well, that's when my nerves turn into something else—bravery, maybe? It's not that I'm not scared; it's just that when you've got mates counting on you, you can't let them down, can you? So yeah, I do get inhibited sometimes, but it’s the bond we share that helps me face those fears head-on.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I try to be kind and considerate, especially to my mates. Like when I stood up for Fleur against family grumbles, or fetched Harry from those Dursley blokes even if it led to some mess-ups. But I gotta say, there're times when I'm a bit of a prat, too. And sometimes my bravery or quick thinking ends up causing more trouble than I meant to, like getting stuck in the fireplace fetching Harry. So, yeah, I care a lot about people, but being considerate? Well, that's something I'm still working on!

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: Efficient? Me? Haha, I suppose you could say I'm more about getting things done quickly, even if it means a bit of a mess along the way. When it comes to dodging hexes or finding a quick exit from a tricky situation, well, I’ve got some tricks up my sleeve. But hey, let’s face it, I’m not always the most organized bloke around. Sometimes it’s just easier to jump in head-first and clean up later, right? Anyway, I reckon if it means keeping me and my mates safe, then it’s all worth it.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm always calm in tense situations—I tend to get a bit nervous and sometimes my temper flares up. But when it comes down to it, and especially when I've got Harry and Hermione by my side, I manage to hold it together. It's like, yeah, I might feel all sorts of stuff inside, but my loyalty to my friends and the need to do what's right just takes over. That's how I keep going, even when things look pretty dark.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine work? Nah, that doesn't really sound like my cup of tea. I mean, sure, it can be steady and all, but I reckon there's more excitement in being an Auror, facing new challenges and dodging curses every day. And let's not forget the time we had to save Buckbeak and that whole mess with the Dementors – those weren't exactly nine-to-five jobs, were they? I guess I just thrive on the unexpected, and besides, with Harry and Hermione around, things never get dull. There's always some adventure or other waiting around the corner, and I wouldn't have it any other way.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I'm more of a loyal mate than the most outgoing person you might meet. When it comes to standing by my friends, there ain't no stopping me. But give me a crowd full of strangers, and I'll probably end up blushing or saying something daft. Still, I've learned to step out of my shell a bit more over the years, especially when it counts. Like facing down a bunch of Death Eaters with just my wand and some Felix Felicis for luck. And let's not forget visiting Sirius in Hogsmeade, or even just talking about our odd ideas for connecting with ghosts at the party. It's all about the company and knowing you're doing something that matters, you know? So yeah, I can be sociable enough when it’s for a good cause or with people I care about.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got a bit of a temper, especially when I'm feeling left out or worried about my mates. Sometimes it can come off as rude, but really, it's just me being honest and protective. I'm not always the best at controlling my impulses, but I do try to make things right after, like when I went back to the hospital wing to be with Hermione after I stormed off. My friends know I'd never mean to hurt anyone on purpose; it's just how I show I care, albeit sometimes in a clumsy way.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Well, I suppose it depends on what kind of plan we're talking about. If it’s something straightforward like figuring out how to sneak into Hogsmeade or planning a party, sometimes I can be pretty good at sticking to those plans. But when it comes to big, dangerous stuff like breaking into Gringotts or fighting dementors, mate, I don't always think things through as much as I should. My head gets caught up in wanting to do right by my friends and protecting what’s important, and I just sort of dive in. That’s not to say I never make a plan—I mean, saving Buckbeak took some serious strategizing—but usually, it’s a bit more on-the-fly. And hey, if it means doing something for Harry or Hermione, I’ll follow through no matter what, even if I end up feeling a bit jealous or uncertain along the way.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Yeah, I do get nervous easily, especially when it comes to stuff that could hurt my friends. Like that time Hermione was making Polyjuice Potion, or when Harry was having those visions and we knew You-Know-Who was coming after us. But you know, when it really counts, I try to push past it and do what needs to be done. After all, it's not just about me—it's about keeping Harry and Hermione safe, no matter how scared I am.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Well, I've always been more of a hands-on kinda guy, if you know what I mean. But watching those ghosts at the party and coming up with that eerie platter with George? That was pretty cool, got me thinking about connecting with them in a different way. And then there's Quidditch, which always makes me feel alive and ready for anything! At the end of the day, though, it's my mates and the adventures we get into that really make me reflect on what matters. Whether it's helping out Aurors or facing down dark stuff with Harry and Hermione, there's always room to learn and grow, you know?

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I've got loads of artistic interests, but watching the twins create stuff at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes always did give me a real kick. There's something pretty amazing about how they think up all those jokes and pranks. Besides, I reckon if you're good at Defense Against the Dark Arts, there's a bit of creativity involved too, right? And hey, even though I didn't ace all my O.W.L.s, I did okay in some subjects that mattered more to me. At the end of the day, I'm more about action and being there for my mates when it counts.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon working together with others isn't half bad, especially when it comes to facing some real dark stuff. Like when we went to see Sirius, it felt good having Harry and Hermione there, you know? It's like we're stronger together, and honestly, I'd rather have a laugh and a good chat while we figure things out than go at it alone. Even if sometimes it leads to a bit of chaos, like getting stuck in that fireplace trying to fetch Harry, it's all worth it because of the mates you've got. So yeah, I do like to cooperate, particularly with the people I care about. There's nothing like having your back covered by your best friends.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Well, I've definitely had my share of moments where I've found myself a bit lost in the shuffle. But when it really matters, like standing up for mates or facing down dark wizards, I reckon I can focus pretty well. It's just sometimes, with all the chaos and danger around, keeping my mind straight on one thing can be a real challenge. But hey, with a bit of luck and the right motivation, I'm usually good to go.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm particularly sophisticated in any of those things, but hey, I've got my own kind of magic, right? I mean, literature can be okay if it's about wizards and battles and stuff like that, but art and music aren't really my thing. I reckon I'm more about action and keeping my friends safe than sitting around reading poetry or whatever. But you know, there's always room for a bit of laughter and fun, even when the world's going topsy-turvy.
